node.title: Man dies after swimming across Cook Strait
node.description: A man who attempted to swim across the Cook Strait has reportedly died just after completing the feat of endurance.

node.title: S&P Global Ratings reaffirms New Zealand's AA+ rating
node.description: Credit rating agency S&P Global Ratings has reaffirmed New Zealand's AA+ rating with a stable outlook because of how well the country has handled the pandemic.

node.title: Council confident of progress over derelict 'dirty 30' buildings
node.description: Four years ago, Christchurch City Council declared it was going to get tough on the owners of 30 central city buildings left derelict since the 2011 earthquake.

node.title: Drivers swept away in flash floods in Australia, more rain to come
node.description: Widespread flash floods unleashed by heavy rain in Australia have swept cars off the road and drowned motorists, including an emergency services volunteer.

node.title: Ukraine, Covid protesters battle for attention in capital
node.description: Ukrainians and their supporters at a Wellington protest say it's agonising not being able to help those at home, but are unimpressed at a request to merge with the anti-Covid mandate protest.

node.title: Burglar bear: DNA evidence spares 500lb 'Hank the Tank'
node.description: California's burliest burglar is no longer the lone suspect in nearly 40 home break-ins across the Lake Tahoe region, wildlife officials have said.

node.title: All Blacks Sevens champion Joeli Vidiri dies
node.description: Former All Black and Blues winger Joeli Vidiri has died.

node.title: Australia's Senate wants overhaul of plant-based protein labelling laws
node.description: Plant-based food products should not use words like "beef" and "chicken", nor use images of animals on packaging, an Australian Senate inquiry says.

node.title: Retired SWAT officer acquitted in Florida movie theater shooting
node.description: Retired Tampa police Captain Curtis Reeves had been charged with second-degree murder for killing Chad Oulson.

node.title: Get unvaxed cops back on the job after court ruling - Police Association
node.description: The Police Association says officers who lost their jobs should be allowed to return to work after a High Court Ruling quashed a Covid-19 vaccine mandate.

node.title: Pompeo and Noem criticize Putin while navigating potential 2024 runs
node.description: Both criticized Putin, but sided with President Trump in saying the Russian leader is "smart."

node.title: Joe Biden reveals history-making Supreme Court pick
node.description: President Joe Biden has selected federal appellate judge Ketanji Brown Jackson to become the first Black woman to serve on the US Supreme Court, the White House says.

node.title: Woman reaches settlement with employer over period pain sick leave
node.description: An employee who complained she was criticised for taking one sick day due to menstruation-related illness has reached a settlement with her employer.

node.title: Anti-mandate protesters march across Auckland Harbour Bridge
node.description: All southbound traffic lanes on State Highway One over the Auckland Harbour Bridge have now reopened after they were closed while anti-mandate protesters marched across the bridge.

node.title: Person stabbed at Wellington hotel, witnesses sought
node.description: A 30-year-old man has been charged following a stabbing at Hotel Waterloo on Bunny Street in Wellington last night.

node.title: Record rise in Covid-19 cases due to a backlog in processing, modeller says
node.description: A Covid-19 modeller says testing and data-processing backlogs are probably behind the record jump in cases.

node.title: Katrina Brownlee's journey from rock bottom to success
node.description: A look inside the case that began the day Brownlee nearly lost her life at the hands of her ex-fiancé.

node.title: 4.4 million galaxies are visible in this new map of the night sky
node.description: The researchers captured 3,500 hours of observations — enough data to fill 20,000 laptops.

node.title: Winter storm dumps multiple inches of snow on the Northeast
node.description: Conditions are forecast to improve overnight as the system moves off the New England coast.

node.title: 'No reason' for MIQ when community cases outnumber border ones - advocate
node.description: A group representing overseas New Zealanders says it's "absolutely bonkers" that returning Kiwis have to isolate - some in MIQ - when there are 12,000 daily cases in the community.

node.title: Bannon claims he didn't "willfully" commit crime in defying subpoenas
node.description: In a new court filing, his attorneys say he didn't comply because he was heeding his lawyers' advice and didn't know he was committing a crime.

node.title: Progress on Iran nuclear deal, but major issues remain -US official
node.description: Progress has been made in negotiations toward reviving the 2015 Iran nuclear deal, but tough problems remain, US official says.

node.title: No change on wait between children's Covid-19 vaccines
node.description: Reducing the time between Covid-19 vaccine doses for 5 to 11-year-olds has been rejected by the government's expert advisers.

node.title: Three seriously injured after central city fight
node.description: Police are examining the scene in Auckland where a "serious altercation" left three people with serious injuries.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," February 27, 2022
node.description: Representative Liz Cheney, House Majority Whip James Clyburn and more appear on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" Sunday.

node.title: The Week in Politics: Ardern, Luxon, Peters and the protesters
node.description: Analysis - Another week of protest politics, with Primie Minister Jacinda Ardern describing National leader Christopher Luxon's comments as "dangerously close to sympathy".

node.title: Cases of highly pathogenic bird flu detected in Delaware and Michigan
node.description: The CDC said the avian flu viruses don't typically infect humans.

node.title: Warehouse manager wanted in theft of $1 million worth of COVID-19 tests
node.description: Carlitos Peralta, 33, allegedly sent nearly 100 shipments of COVID tests to his home.

node.title: Works to begin on flooding problem spots near Kawakawa
node.description: Two flood-prone Northland towns will have five million dollars worth of work done to reduce the risk of further inundation.

node.title: Ukraine urges residents to defend capital as Kyiv braces for Russian assault
node.description: The sound of gunfire has echoed through Ukraine's capital Kyiv as Russian tanks were filmed entering the city for the first time.
